1.Cons: Heavily outsourced, almost to a detriment. Very little knowledge kept as consultants and partners come and go.

3.Pros: If you work at Mcdonald's, make sure you move up to the assistant manager position. It's more pay for doing a little less work. Decent benefits.
3.Cons: Long hours and very tiring. I would not do it again if I could go back in time. Customers are the worst and rudest people who look down at you for working at Mcdonald's.

4.Pros: I met some amazing people through my internship that I'm still friends with today. You have access to top-level executives, learn about an amazing brand, work on a collaboration project to present to management
4.Cons: I knew people who worked alone and not with other interns. It's much better when you're together, to ask for help and bounce ideas off of one another.

5.Cons: Abusive atmosphereHigh turnoverforced to stay lateNo recognition or performance reviews

7.Pros: Decent hours as well as days off, flexible with schooling schedules. Polite co-workers.
